newsitem.title: USA: American Express realigns some business units.
newsitem.headline: American Express realigns some business units.

text.p: American Express Co. said Thursday it was reorganizing some of its financial and business units to streamline operations.
The company also said Bill Heron has decided to resign as president of American Express Financial Direct, but he will stay on to help with the transition until a successor is named.

"Overall, the changes are designed to place businesses that serve similar markets under common management and enable us to serve customers more effectively," Chairman and Chief Executive Harvey Golub and President Ken Chenault said in a letter to employees.

In the realignment, American Express Financial Direct will become part of American Express Financial Advisors. American Express Tax & Business Services (TBS) will become a part of American Express Small Business Services.
The TBS unit had been part of Workplace Financial Services, which will be disbanded and its operations shifted elsewhere.
Financial Direct, which includes an online brokerage service, was set up as a stand-alone business in May 1996.
Referring to Financial Direct, Golub and Chenault said in the memo there is a need "to expand our product offerings and attract new customers to the franchise more quickly than we have."
Shares of American Express rose $1.19 to $78.625 on the New York Stock Exchange.
